department.en: Department of Space Science and Engineering

goal.ch: 太空任務的設計與執行是一種跨領域的挑戰：我們必須先從任務目標的定義與價值開始，再從之延伸出任務的作業與工程需求及因應方式。本課將針對太空任務設計的重要系統與概念進行入門介紹，並提供國家太空中心、產學或INSPIRE衛星任務實作的應用、體驗機會。
goal.en: The design and execution of a space mission requires an interdisciplinary effort that extends from the definition of a mission objective, to the formulation and solution to the operational and engineering requirements necessary to meet the objective. This course will introduce students to the key subsystems and concepts required to fully conceive and design a space mission, and provide an opportunity to work on ongoing small satellite missions with TASA, INSPIRE, or industry partners.

outline.ch: 修本課的學生將分組，針對指定衛星酬載提出考量到科學或其他相關需求的太空任務目標。接下來會依照任務目標及酬載規格延伸出太空飛行體的作業及工程需求，並評估可行之因應對策。這個流程最後將產生一個針對指定酬載的太空任務的概念設計方案，以及相關系統的基礎設計藍圖。
outline.en: Students will apply these concepts to formulating a mission objective for an assigned payload, based upon the scientific or other needs that the payload will satisfy. From the objective, operational and engineering requirements for the required spacecraft subsystems to support the payload will be defined, and solutions identified through trade studies. This will result in a conceptual design for a space mission utilizing the assigned payload that considers both the overall objective, as well as the design of the spacecraft subsystems required.
